meanings.definition: A mythical creature in Australian Aboriginal folklore.
meanings.sent1: The children listened wide-eyed to stories about bunyips by the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The museum had an exhibit on bunyips and other mythical creatures.
meanings.sent3: The tour guide joked that the bunyips were probably just mischievous kangaroos in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the forest at night made the trees look like lurking bunyips.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting of a bunyip was so detailed, it seemed almost real.

meanings.sent1: The explorers claimed to have seen bunyips in the swamp.
meanings.sent2: The researchers debated the existence of bunyips in the outback.
meanings.sent3: The bunyips in the pond seemed to be having a playful gathering.
meanings.sent4: The old tale described the bunyips as protectors of the river.
meanings.sent5: The children's book featured colorful illustrations of the bunyips.
